title: 115_hr1483
content: The Act may be cited as the "Litigation Relief for Forest Management Projects Act". It pertains to the Forest and Rangeland Renewable Resources Planning Act of 1974. The Forest and Rangeland Renewable Resources Planning Act of 1974 is amended to include provisions for public participation and consultation in land management plans. After approval of the plans, no additional consultation is required by the Secretary under any other law. The Forest and Rangeland Renewable Resources Planning Act of 1974 is amended to include provisions for public participation and consultation in land management plans. No additional consultation is required by the Secretary under any other law once a land management plan has been adopted. The Forest and Rangeland Renewable Resources Planning Act of 1974 is amended to include provisions for public participation and consultation in land management plans, including projects in critical habitat areas or significant modifications to land management plans. The definition of Secretary is also updated in the Act. The Forest and Rangeland Renewable Resources Planning Act of 1974 is amended to update the definition of the Secretary as the `Secretary'. Conforming amendments are made throughout the Act to replace "Secretary of Agriculture" with "Secretary". The Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976 is established. The Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976 is amended to include provisions for public involvement and to specify that no additional consultation is required after the approval of land use plans. The Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976 is amended to include provisions for public involvement and to specify that no additional consultation is required after the approval of land use plans. The act also outlines conditions under which listing a species as threatened or endangered, or designating critical habitat, would not require further consultation. References in the Code of Federal Regulations are modified to reflect changes in agencies and terminology. Any reference to Public Law 93-205 regarding projects related to threatened or endangered species or critical habitat is preserved in this Act. The Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976 is amended to include provisions for public involvement in the development or revision of land use plans. No additional consultation is required after plan approval.
